Award.AwardTitle: International School for Cosmic Ray Astrophysics: Workshop to be held in Sicily, Italy July 4-10, 2012
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award will provide participant support for US graduate students to participate in the International School of Cosmic Ray Astrophysics in 2012 to be held on July 4-10, 2012 in Erice, Sicily, Italy. The theme of the Course is "A New Era in Particle Astrophysics." It will present the new experiments, new experimental results and the current understanding of them. The course will emphasize the multi-messenger approach to astrophysics.

For Broader Impacts, it has a particular focus on early career scientists and graduate students. This summer school is important in the education of such young scientists not only because of the lectures they listen to, but also because during the School they directly communicate with the older experienced scientists who are the lecturers.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The award is for the support of US students in the International School of Cosmic Ray Astrophysics (http://laspace.lsu.edu/iscra/ISCRA2012), This is a summer school for advanced graduate students and young postdoctoral candidates. It is organized biannually by the Ettore Majorana Center for Scientific Colture in Erice, Italy from 1978. Many of the former lecturers and students of ISCRA are distinguished scientists and the School is considered one of the best in the world.

The current co-directoirs of the School are John P. Wefel (louisiana State University) and Todor Stanev (University of Delaware). The cost for a students is 100 euros per day that includes lodging and food. There is no additional tuition char4ge. For one week course this is close to $1,000 depending on the exchange rate. We asked for the support of seven students.

The 2012 course of ISCRA took place from the 4th to the 10th of Julay. It included 10 lecturers, 1 seniour participant and 38 students. Six of the students were from US and were supported by the grant. There were also nine german students, as well as students from Brazil, Spain, Poland, MexicoCanada, Ireland and the Netherlands.

Because of the small number of US applicants not all funds from the award were spent. We are returning to the NSF $1,124.90.
